content: What's the process for becoming a maintainer for an existing tier 3 target? I'm not aware of an existing maintainer for DragonFly BSD (please point me to the docs if I've missed something), and I'm willing to try to fill that role.

@Ryan Zoeller There isn't a well-defined process for that, but roughly speaking, for any target that pre-dates the target tier policy, I'd send a PR adding target-specific documentation that lists yourself as the maintainer, and in the pull request description, make a fresh proposal as if you were proposing a new tier 3 target, checking off all the policy items.

That serves the dual purpose of giving us updated policy information and target documentation for an existing target and showing enough commitment to working on the target to help people feel comfortable adding you as a maintainer.
(In the PR, you'd note that the target already exists, but doesn't have a maintainer on file, and you'd like to become the maintainer.)
Also would help answer the "wait, why do we have this?" and "would anyone object if we nuked this code?" questions in the future
Makes sense. Is there an existing list of which targets do/don't have active maintainers on file?
Or rather, where would I go to find that documentation?
Some maintainers are listed in the Platform Support section of the documentation, like this: https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/rustc/platform-support/x86_64-unknown-none.html
Some of the bigger platforms have "ping" groups which can be pinged on GitHub when there is an issue related to their target. They are listed here.
And the members of those groups are managed in the team repo: https://github.com/rust-lang/team/blob/master/teams/arm.toml

hello! I've just reported an ICE with GATs and i thought I'd try out seeing if i can dig around in the compiler. I've cloned rust and run x.py, but when selecting "contribute to the compiler" i get the following:

fatal: your current branch 'master' does not have any commits yet
thread 'main' panicked at 'command did not execute successfully: "git" "log" "-1" "--date=short" "--pretty=format:%cd"
expected success, got: exit status: 128', src/bootstrap/channel.rs:50:24
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:00:02

any advice?

Also (if it helps) examples of past proposals for tier 3 targets:
https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Amajor-change+tier+3
